title: How to Add an Egg to Ramen: Tips for Creating a Flavorful Meal

steps.title: Place the egg and water in a pot.
steps.content: Place the egg and water in a pot. Pour enough water into the pot to cover the egg by 1 inch (2.5 cm). Set the pot on the stove. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Bring the water to a boil and turn off the heat.
steps.content: Bring the water to a boil and turn off the heat. Heat the pot over high so the water begins to boil. Turn the heat off, but leave the pot on the burner. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Rest the egg in the water for 10 minutes.
steps.content: Rest the egg in the water for 10 minutes. The egg will finish cooking in the hot water even with the heat off. Turning off the heat will prevent the egg from overcooking and becoming tough. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Peel the egg
steps.content: Peel the egg and reheat the water in the pot. Use a slotted spoon to lift the egg out of the hot water. Leave the hot water in the pot and turn the heat back on to high. Run the egg under cold water, so it's easier to peel. [4] X Research source Ensure that there aren't any bits of shell stuck on the peeled egg. You may want to rinse the peeled egg under water to get any bits of shell off.

steps.title: Cook the ramen
steps.content: Cook the ramen . Once the water in the pot is boiling again, add the ramen noodles. Boil them for 3 minutes or until they're as soft as you like. For soupier noodles, leave the water in the pot or drain the noodles and return them to the pot, if you like mainly noodles. [5] X Research source

steps.title: Season and serve the ramen with a hard-boiled egg.
steps.content: Season and serve the ramen with a hard-boiled egg. Stir any seasonings or vegetables into the noodles. Slice the hard-boiled egg in half and add it to the ramen. Serve the ramen while it's still hot. [6] X Research source You can store the leftover ramen in the refrigerator for 3 to 4 days in an airtight container. Keep in mind that the noodles will continue to soften and swell as they soak.

steps.title: Boil water and add an egg.
steps.content: Boil water and add an egg. Measure 2 cups (475 ml) of water into a pot and turn the heat to medium so the water bubbles gently. Lower 1 whole egg into the water. [7] X Research source

steps.title: Simmer the egg for 7 to 8 minutes.
steps.content: Simmer the egg for 7 to 8 minutes. Let the egg cook gently until it's as cooked as you like. If you want a runnier egg yolk, cook it for 7 minutes. For a more set egg, simmer it for 8 minutes. [8] X Research source

steps.title: Chill the soft boiled egg for 30 seconds.
steps.content: Chill the soft boiled egg for 30 seconds. Set a bowl of ice water next to your stove. Use a slotted spoon to lift the soft boiled egg out of the pot and place it directly into the ice water. Let it chill for 30 seconds, so it stops cooking. [9] X Research source

steps.title: Cook and season the ramen.
steps.content: Cook and season the ramen. Heat the water in the pot over high heat until it boils. Stir in the ramen noodles and boil them for 3 minutes or until they're the texture you want. Drain off as much water as you want and leave the noodles in the pot. Stir the seasoning packet into the ramen or use your favorite seasonings instead. [10] X Research source

steps.title: Peel and add the egg to the ramen.
steps.content: Peel and add the egg to the ramen. Crack and peel away the egg shell. You can place the whole egg into your ramen or slice it in half and put it in the noodles. Slurp up the noodles while they're still hot.

steps.title: Cook the noodles in the water for 3 minutes.
steps.content: Cook the noodles in the water for 3 minutes. Measure 2 cups (475 ml) of water into a pot and bring it to a boil over high heat. Add the ramen and break up the noodles as they cook.

steps.title: Add the seasonings.
steps.content: Add the seasonings. Open the seasoning packet that came with the ramen and add it to the pot with the noddles and broth. If you're using other seasonings instead of the packet, add them now.

steps.title: Beat the egg.
steps.content: Beat the egg. Crack 1 egg into a small prep bowl and beat it with a fork until the yolk and white are combined. [11] X Research source

steps.title: Whisk in and cook the egg.
steps.content: Whisk in and cook the egg. Keep the heat over medium and slowly pour in the beaten egg. Whisk while you add the egg so it cooks and forms ribbons in the broth. Enjoy the egg drop ramen while it's still hot. If you'd like larger clumps of egg in the broth, pour in the beaten egg, but let it cook for a minute before you stir it in the broth.

steps.title: Cook the ramen for 1 1/2 minutes.
steps.content: Cook the ramen for 1 1/2 minutes. Measure 2 cups (475 ml) of water into a pot and turn the heat to high. Once the water boils, add the package of ramen. Boil the noodles until they start to separate and stir them a little. This should take 1 1/2 minutes.

steps.title: Add the seasonings and crack an egg into the pot.
steps.content: Add the seasonings and crack an egg into the pot. Stir in the seasoning packet that came with the noodles or squirt in your favorite sauces. Turn the heat off of the burner and crack 1 raw egg into the center of the noodles in the pot. [12] X Research source Avoid stirring the egg or it will begin to cook and break into clumps.

steps.title: Cover and rest the egg in ramen for 2 minutes.
steps.content: Cover and rest the egg in ramen for 2 minutes. Put a lid on the pot and set a timer for 2 minutes. The egg will poach and the noodles will finish cooking. [13] X Research source

steps.title: Serve the ramen with poached egg.
steps.content: Serve the ramen with poached egg. Remove the lid and slowly transfer the ramen and egg to a serving bowl. Enjoy the ramen and egg while they're still hot.

steps.title: Cook the ramen for 3 minutes.
steps.content: Cook the ramen for 3 minutes. Pour 2 cups (475 ml) of water into a pot and bring it to a boil over high heat. Add the ramen and boil the noodles for 3 minutes. Stir the ramen to break up the noodles. [14] X Research source

steps.title: Drain and season the ramen.
steps.content: Drain and season the ramen. Drain the ramen through a colander and return the noodles to a skillet. Stir the seasoning packet into the noodles or sprinkle in your favorite spices instead. [15] X Research source

steps.title: Fry the noodles for 2 minutes.
steps.content: Fry the noodles for 2 minutes. Turn the heat to medium and stir fry the noodles until they crisp up a little. This should take 2 minutes. [16] X Research source

steps.title: Whisk a beaten egg into the noodles.
steps.content: Whisk a beaten egg into the noodles. Crack 1 egg into a bowl and beat it with a fork. Add the beaten egg to the skillet with the noodles. Stir and cook the scrambled egg with the noodle until it's completely cooked. This should take 2 to 4 minutes. [17] X Research source

steps.title: Serve the hot scrambled egg ramen.
steps.content: Serve the hot scrambled egg ramen. Once the egg is as cooked as you like, turn off the heat and transfer the noodles to a serving bowl. Use a fork or chopsticks to eat the hot ramen. [18] X Research source You can store the leftover ramen in an airtight container in the refrigerator for 3 to 5 days, but the noodles may soften and swell.
